actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interstate and Foreign Commerce.

official_title: A bill to revise and extend the provisions of title XII of the Public Health Service Act relating to emergency medical services systems.

summary.text: Emergency Medical Services Amendments - Extends the authorization for appropriations through fiscal year 1979 for emergency medical service systems under the Public Health Service Act. Revises provisions related to grants and contracts for the establishment, initial operation, expansion, and improvement of such systems and grants and contracts for research in emergency medical techniques. Authorizes the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare to conduct and support programs designed to aid in the treatment and rehabilitation of individuals injured by burns. Directs the Secretary to conduct studies of: (1) the categories of patients which should be included in a uniform reporting system to evaluate the effectiveness of emergency medical service systems in reducing death and disability; and (2) the effectiveness of Federal assistance for communication systems of public safety agencies.

titles.title: A bill to revise and extend the provisions of title XII of the Public Health Service Act relating to emergency medical services systems.
